alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 12:20PM EDT until April 14 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River at Robinson Township affecting Ottawa County. Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. For the Grand River...including Jackson, Eaton Rapids - USGS, Eaton Rapids, Dimondale, Lansing, Grand Ledge, Portland, Ionia, Lowell, Ada, Comstock Park, Grand Rapids, Eastmanville, Robinson Township... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River near Comstock Park. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Homes along Willow Drive and Abrigador Trail have flooded basements and Abrigador Trail is closed. Riverbank Street northeast in Plainfield Township is flooded and homes along Riverbank Street have flooded basements. Konkle Drive northeast in Plainfield township is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:41 PM EDT Monday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:41 PM EDT Monday was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Thursday morning and continue falling to 10.0 feet early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 03/08/1974. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
